result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonja K. Gillespie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sonja K. Gillespie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sonja K. Gillespie was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Sonja K. Gillespie was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not enter into or loiter near taverns/bars or liquor stores.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription and do not possess drug related paraphernalia.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $696.58 plus surcharges; jointly & severally with Co-Deft.
May not have contact with Carl W. Young or any Walmart Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Do not enter any retail store/venue without a chaperone who will monitor her activities at all times.  Do not use any self checkout registers at anytime.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not have contact with Carl W. Y or any Walmart Store, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Do not enter any Retail Store/Venue w/out chaperone who will monitor activities at all times.  Do not use any self checkout registers.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Attorney Andrea K Rufo appeared on behalf of Defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Per Lt. Zoerner the DE is no longer in custody in the Racine Co. Jail and was released on 10/19/16, but she should of been provided today's court date upon her release. Court finds notice was mailed to the DE in the Racine Co . Jail.  DE is now present in court and appears late.  Parties go off record to allow Atty Rufo a few minutes to speak with DE.  Parties return on the record and Atty Rufo's requests sentencing be adjourned.  Upon hearing argument her motion is denied.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $696.58 which shall be joint and several with co-defendant.
Count 1 -   Defendant is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP and given credit for 4 days; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years of Extended Supervision.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Count 2 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions Consecutive to Count 1.    
Defefendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge in both counts and notice is given.   Court Costs also ordered in both counts.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.(Court reporter corrected to Katie Giebel 10/25/16 bl)
Sentencing hearing on October 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing rescheduled to 10/21/16 at 8:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Rufo
Court has reviewed and approves DOC's request to adjourn sentencing to allow more time to complete PSI.
Email correspondence received from William Robinson @ DOC requesting additional time to complete PSI due to the assigned agent being out sick.
Sentencing hearing on September 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Email correspondence received from William Robinson @ DOC stating PSI will not be completed by 9/6/16 so they are requesting sentencing be rescheduled for 9/6.
Due to courts congested calendar on 9/8/16; Sentencing moved to 9/6/16 at 8:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Rufo, but will be contingent upon PSI being completed in time and agent notified.

Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the State.  The defendant appeared in custody with Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  On state's motion, counts 3-5 are dismissed.  The defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2; court finds the defendant guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH set for 9/8/16 @ 9:30.  Bond continued.
Email corresondence received from Atty Rufo

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.
NO RECORD TAKEN:  Per email corresondence received from Atty Rufo case will be resolved with a plea on Monday.

State's Amended List of Witnesses and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Thomas Binger

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Breckenfelder appears specially for Atty Rufo on behalf of Defendant Sonja K. Gillespie who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Breckenfelder has no explanation for DE's non appearance but requests any warrant be stayed.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $3000 Cash Bond, but warrant is stayed until Monday, 4/4/16 at which time bond will be forfeited in no voluntary appearance is requested.

DE is now present in court along with Atty Breckenfelder.  DE is late coming from Beloit, WI and Court orders DE to make all her appearances on time.  Bench warrant is vacated (not yet issued) and bond is reinstated.  Co-Defendant is also present with his attorney.  Cases are not resolved.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for Attorney Binger and for the State. Defendant, Sonja K. Gillespie, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo states DE appeared late after last hearing was called due to her residence being in Beloit, WI.  Bench warrant is vacated; not yet issued and bond is reinstated.  Co-Deft's case is scheduled for 3/28/16 and hearing is adjourned.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:20 am.
Court approves request to stay warrant to allow voluntary appearance next week.  Voluntary Appearance on 3/18/16 at 10:10 AM.
Email correspondence requesting a voluntary appearance be set some time next week.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Atty Andrea Rufo appears in court on behalf of Defendant Sonja K. Gillespie who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
No appearance by the DE.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond, but will stay warrant until tomorrow at which time bond will be forfeited.
